name: Ruba Abu-Salma
tagline: Ph.D. Student at University College London (UCL)
body:
I am a Ph.D. student in the [Department of Computer Science](http://www.cs.ucl.ac.uk/home/) at [University College London (UCL)](http://www.ucl.ac.uk), under the joint supervision of Prof. [M. Angela Sasse](http://sec.cs.ucl.ac.uk/people/m_angela_sasse/) and Dr. [Sarah Meiklejohn](http://www0.cs.ucl.ac.uk/staff/S.Meiklejohn/). We belong to the [Information Security Research Group](http://sec.cs.ucl.ac.uk/home/). My research is funded by a Google Research Award.

I earned an M.Sc. (with Distinction) in Information Security from UCL in 2014. My dissertation was on Differentially Private Statistics. Before joining UCL, I obtained a B.Sc. (1st Hons) in Computer Engineering from the [American University of Sharjah](https://www.aus.edu/).

Outside of academia, I aspire to become a professional photographer. I have taken several photography courses at [City Academy](http://www.city-academy.com/) in the UK. I am also an active member of the [Photography Society](http://uclu.org/clubs-societies/photo-society) at UCL. Personally, I <3 language learning and travelling.

Find me on Twitter: [Ruba_AbuSalma](https://twitter.com/Ruba_AbuSalma)
